devdoc.author: Carlos Alegre Urquiz (GitHub --> https://github.com/CarlosAlegreUr)
devdoc.details: To use it make your contract inherit InputControl contract and add the isAllowedInput() modifier in the functions you desire to control their inputs. Add to them an extra parameter, this parameter should be a 32 bytes hash given by the contract owner in some front-end back-end communication.Additionally you can override callAllowInputsFor() if you please mixing this functionality with, for example, other useful ones like Owner or AccessControl contracts from OpenZeppelin.

callAllowInputsFor(address,bytes32[],str.details: Override this function in your contract to use allowInputsFor() mixed with other useful contracts and modifiers like Owner and AccessControl contracts of OpenZeppelin. See param specifications in allowInputsFor() docs.

returns._0: Allowed inputs from `_address` when calling `_funcSignature`. Index of inputs on the inputs array shows in which time calling `_funcSignature` that input can be used.

devdoc.title: Input Control.

userdoc.notice: InputControl can be used to control which inputs can some addresses send to your smart contracts functions.
